abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column remembers late high school soccer coach Rudi Klobach, who coached American midfielder Carli Lloyd, star of United States women's national soccer team at World Cup, from 1997 to 2000; notes Klobach suffered from ALS, and died in January 2015.
lead_paragraph: Rudi Klobach, who coached Lloyd in high school and followed her career closely, died in January after a three-year battle with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

headline.main: Nation’s Roars for Carli Lloyd Are Missing the Voice of a Cherished Fan
headline.print_headline: Nation’s Roars for a Star Are Missing the Voice of a Cherished Fan

snippet: Rudi Klobach, who coached Lloyd in high school and followed her career closely, died in January after a three-year battle with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
